intro: Aeglopsis alexandrae, commonly known as the Alexandra's corymbia, is a rare shrub native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences and small, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often covered in a fine, powdery bloom. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
